info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 22 at 4:43PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Mesa and south central Garfield Counties through 530 PM MDT... At 443 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northwest of Palisade, or 9 miles northeast of Grand Junction, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... De Beque and Parachute. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 28 and 80. U.S. Highway 50 in Colorado between mile markers 32 and 42. Colorado 65 between mile markers 44 and 61. Colorado 141 between mile markers 152 and 162. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
